title: Professional Experience
subtitle: A summary of the experiences that have shaped my journey as a developer, always driven by continuous learning, technical improvement, and a commitment to delivering practical, high-quality solutions.

list.description: Studying modern web app technologies with React and Spring.
list.tasks: My first contact with the professional environment was at ML Software House, where I learned from experienced professionals and dove into the fundamentals of web development. Although my role was more focused on hands-on learning than on critical tasks, that period was essential to building my technical foundation and understanding real-world projects.
details: Actively participated in an internship program focused on modern web application development, with guidance on agile methodologies and coding best practices.
Studied and applied technologies such as React (JavaScript, JSX, state management, reusable components) to develop responsive and dynamic interfaces.
Worked on the back end with Spring (Java), helping create and maintain RESTful APIs and integrations with relational databases.
Fixed bugs, implemented visual improvements, and delivered incremental updates on both front end and back end with attention to UX and performance.
Worked with mid- and senior-level developers, participated in code reviews, and practiced Git version control.
Gained exposure to MySQL, GitHub, and Trello, as well as CI/CD concepts and automated testing.

list.company: Federal Institute of Southern Minas — Machado Campus
list.description: Maintenance and updates of the campus institutional portal.
list.tasks: This internship was a turning point in my path. For the first time, I faced a setting with real demands, deadlines, and direct impact on users. I worked on maintaining and improving the institutional portal, learning Joomla from scratch — a widely used CMS for building and managing dynamic websites with customizable modules and extensions — while handling important technical responsibilities.
details: Responsible for maintaining and updating the campus institutional portal built on Joomla (PHP-based CMS).
Worked mostly autonomously, serving as the main technical point of contact for the website during the internship.
Performed layout adjustments, content updates, and section restructuring to improve navigation and user experience.
Self-taught Joomla’s core features and extensions, including menu management, user permissions, modules, and templates.

list.description: Technical lead for web projects using React, PHP, and Firebase.
list.tasks: During my time at MZZI, I worked with full autonomy on web systems from concept to delivery. Each project brought new technical and creative challenges, where I could experiment, learn, and propose solutions that truly impacted the client.
details: Project-based web developer serving as the sole technical lead for development and maintenance.
Handled all project phases: requirements, development, testing, deployment, and support.
Built dynamic, responsive interfaces using React or PHP on the front end, per project demands.
Used Firebase for authentication, notifications, and data hosting.
Implemented secure authentication (OAuth), session management with cookies, and caching strategies for performance.
Focused on load-time optimization, usability, and UX/UI.
Performed testing, debugging, and continuous updates with Git/GitHub versioning.
Delivered autonomously, demonstrating proactivity, organization, and strong command of the tools.
